comments.commentBody: I just don't know how much longer the American public can be subjected to these baseless rants and distractions - I get it - let's scream bloody murder over this baseless claim and maybe folk will set aside his Russian Putin dilemma and taxes we won't ever see because connect the dots will be so much clearer - but drag our amazing Obama - without one scandal in 8 years, into his thorny thicket of lies and brazen deceit - I ask - HOW LOW DOES "45" GO?

• Offering No Evidence....

Tell me something I DON'T know.
You don't know lucky you are, Bobby !
When the founding fathers stipulated a presidential candidate had to be 35 years or over, did they mean biological or developmental age? I think it's the latter, and Trump does not qualify.
It's definitely true. How else was Malia the first to know that Arnold had been kicked off Celebrity Apprentice?
Thanks, I needed that.

I,ve heard of mood swings women endure during menopause and am now unsure if DT needs a gender determination test as he rides the pendulum.If ever there was a "self goal"struck by the US electorate then this one will top the show.Enjoy the ride as this one is one disaster that you can foresee from a mile.

This is sooooo much better than having Hillary as president.

/eyeroll

socrates,

My pro-life views go back years. I am from a long-line of prolifers. My parents were involved in the movement on Cape Cod and went to one of the first maches in Washington. I remember my mother telling me about a woman she met who said that they achieved positive results by doing it quietly and with patience Our results have proven the woman was right. We have achieved much success and the movement has grown beyond our wildest dreams.

I will be attending a pro-life rally at the end of the month in downtown Manhattan. In attendance will be Alveda King, Martin Luther King's niece. She is very involved in the cause and is greatly admired. When I get involved in a cause in which I truly believe, nothing or no one stops me from going all out.

I'm sorry but American food is atrocious. I just said and I don't regret it. I'd rather go hungry than step into an Olive Garden. Once I fasted for a whole day on a road trip rather than enter a McDonald's or its equivalent. I ate street food in Shanghai, Hong Kong, and Naples and it was delicious. I won't eat burgers, chips or American pizza because they are disgusting. Elitist? Sure, and proud of it. And also proud of the fact that my diet of home-cooked farmer's market fare and high-end restaurants has kept me wearing size 4 into my late 4Os when fast-food-fed women half my age are twice as heavy. Good taste is good, whether in literature, fashion or food. It's sad that we have come to a point where people have to apologize for being educated, rational and refined.

I had a long discussion with my teen about insidiousness of The Prosperity Gospel as implied in daily life. This comment, to me, is illustrative...

I live in a pastoral wonderland: dark skies, conservation trails, farms, deer, bear(s) - all within a relatively short commute to Cambridge. My siblings live in the rust belt: failed shopping centers, uneven concrete sidewalks last repaired in the 1950s, houses circumscribed by three-lanes-each-way to Zanesville, or if feeling adventurous, Chillicothe.

What and where we eat, how often we spend time outside, and what we do with our free time (I can't wait to walk on a trail at the end of a day; following a 10 hour shift standing at a cash register, my sibling is less inclined...) is influenced by our environment, which is strongly affected by income.

I am grateful to live here, to have been so lucky. It is a gift - but it's not a moral touchstone.

I loved me some Big Macs growing up and eventually went up to 300 pounds. I lost half the weight and won't eat any McDonalds anymore.

It's not just McDonalds. I cut out Burger King, Wendy's and pretty much most all fast and fried foods.

Last summer I went on a cruise and had french fries every night as part of my meal. Big mistake. My body changed dramatically and suddenly I was couldn't fit into my clothes anymore because what I ate for 7 days. It took me over 6 months to get back into shape and I will probably never eat french fries again (now I realize why I had stopped eating them in the first place).

I do still eat pizza, though. That's the one thing I won't give up.

You think it's a good idea to prevent sex education? Wow! If your daughter came home pregnant, what would you do, tell her to "never darken your doorstep again"?

My experience is that Catholics are just like other people, they come in a variety of flavors and bring their goodness or otherwise with them.

Meanwhile, the Catholic Church seems to have been having some problems with repression and sex lately, don't you think?

Trump probably brought the widow to the event because the media made a big deal about Owens' Dad not wanting to speak with him. Now no one is talking about the Dad anymore.

The fact that she looked up to heaven was the photograph, the moment, everyone wanted. TRUMP definitely wanted it and milked it all he could. I didn't watch it but I read an article in the Washington Post, which said that America bore witness to her pain. What?

She is in pain. So what is Trump going to do to help the Owens family?

I think Mr. Trumps targets should ban together and sue him for libel in a giant class action suit.  Trump is a pathological liar, when he was just a reality game show host, sexual predator/ con man he could hide behind his money and a room full of lawyers.  Now his pathetic circus act is endangering the country.  If as he claims his campaign did not collude with the Russians during the campaign and that he has no financial ties to Russia Trump should welcome an investigation to clear his name.  Instead him and cronies act more desperate and guilty with each passing day.

An insatiable ego combined with absolutely zero impulse control. Russian links or not, the risks of having Mr. Trump continue to run the country has now become untenable. He's far too thin skinned for a job where a thousand critics come straight at you each and every day. Donald Trump made enemies of a tremendous number of Americans during his campaign. He constantly insulted democrats, the media and many republicans. Is Trump really so ignorant as to not expect a barrage of constant criticism, further amplified by his own continuing stream of insults and lies? Why does Trump expect unconditional love from those he still regularly kicks in the teeth? Where does he get off assuming he has the respect of an American public who's intelligence he insults daily with blatant, juvenile lies? I get the impression that even his own party has already had just about enough. It is about time to end the embarrassment of this national charade.

"Talk about who the paranoid ones are."

Pretty obvious...

In the fact-based world, it is the asserter's obligation to substantiate the assertion.

Trump accused Obama of spying on Trump. Thus it is solely Trump's obligation to provide evidence. It is not anyone else's obligation to disprove him.

So if Trump can not provide supporting evidence, then yeah, he pretty much is "lying/delusional".
Would someone please turn off his Twitter account?!?
Heck no, Diane. I got ON Twitter a week ago so I wouldn't miss anything! ha!
Are we going to have to spend taxpayer dollars to "get to the bottom" (Lindsay Graham) of every twitter urge/impulse/Breitbart itch Mr Trump has?
Yes There is firm evidence that the Russians hacked the elections inAmerican. Check it out but not via fake news provided by our lying president.

"If you can't believe a birther, who can you believe?"

Trump is at war with reality. I wonder who's going to win?

And how many peoples lives will be destroyed in the process?

I can't with to see him in jail for the rest of his life on a treason conviction.
It's ok – Trump is white. It's only Black Presidents who shouldn't golf (lest people accuse them of being "lazy").

For a laugh, check out Monty Python's "every sperm is sacred":
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUspLVStPbk

Yawn. A fresh lie from the liar.

Now, how about those Yankees?
No yawn, baby donnie is dangerous!

Leo,

"Such a warrant would only have been granted if the FBI—not the Obama administration—was able to convince a judge that the Trump campaign had credible links to a foreign power."

"The key distinction is that this was an FBI investigation, not an order from the White House itself."

http://fortune.com/2017/03/04/trump-wiretapping-fbi-warrent/

Welcome to reality, Leo.

I'm already tired of the media's fawning over Trump's speech and the rehabilitation of W.

Is this to prepare us for the 2020 Jeb Bush campaign? Sorry -- I'm still not going to vote for Jeb. I wanted TRUMP over Jeb. I was a big fan of the Apprentice and was pleased that he told the truth about the Weapons of Mass Destruction. Who knew that he did that because he had no filter?

Once he started talking about his sexual prowess at the debates, comparing his "hands" with Rubio, I knew that this candidacy had denigrated into the ground but somehow he won the Presidency.

So now the media is trying to rehabilitate Trump, too, because he read a speech.

By the way, I did like Trump but was never going to actually vote for him. I'm a Democrat.

Richard
I guess you don't have anything in the stock market so your perception of America as economically weak must depend on some other measure. The military weak! Surely you jest. What is the current expenditure on the military 500 or 600 billion? How many ISIS fighters is an F-35 going to take out. It could probably obliterate a whole city and take a lot of civilians with it and maybe kill one terrorist. Maybe we need boots on the ground, reinstitute the draft. I doubt if Trump will last a year before he goes back to tv. Being the president is probably boring especially if you are criticized by the "enemy" or the free press.

Classic Trump. Projecting your own misdeeds, crimes and shortcomings on others first before you're found out.
I firmly believe the election WAS rigged. For Trump, buy Russia, in those states he squeaked a win out of. There was absolutely no reason that the Trump campaign should have thought those states were in play. So they suddenly go there just to make it look plausable that they won.
And now he calls Obama a "bad (or sick) guy" That is exactly what Trump is, and he knows everybody is about to find that out. He has the beginnings of Alzheimer's disease, among other mental and health issues, in addition to being just an all around horrible person to deal with in business, as many New Yorkers know (it's actually a small town in that respect).
But saying stuff first makes it hard for others to make the same claim about him, without seeming like they're just retaliating. It's "I know you are but what am I" about everything with this guy.
